New Records: Trayce Jackson-Davis is shooting 22 for 27 (77.7%) over the first five games.
Key Match Events: The Warriors started fast by making 12 of 23 shots (52.2%) to go ahead 28-20.
Zion Williamson was held to 12 points on 5-for-20 shooting to go with 12 rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: Stephen Curry missed his second straight game with a left ankle injury.
Andrew Wiggins also sat out consecutive nights because of low back tightness.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State exercised the third-year contract option on second-year guard Brandin Podziemski, who again directed the offense with Curry sidelined and finished with 13 points, nine rebounds and eight assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pelicans were without guards CJ McCollum and Herb Jones.
The Warriors had to play from behind most of Tuesday's contest, but started fast by making 12 of 23 shots (52.2%) to go ahead 28-20.
Others: The Warriors will host Klay Thompson and the Mavericks on Nov. 12.
Golden State hits the road for five games beginning Saturday at Houston.
